The images were published on a Facebook: 2020, with a caption that translates to English as "Recognize these communist traitors, Setaram Yechury and Brinda Karat. These communists also stood by China in 1962 and Kanhaiya Kumar is also a leader of this party. And today, these people are insulting our Indian army."
The text on the posters in the images re: Indian army down..down, We support to long live China."
Sitaram Yechury and Brinda Karat are bot: Marxist), a left-leaning political organization in India. Kanhaiya Kumar is another politician from the Communist Party of India.
A reverse image search on Google reveale: India, pro-China placards. The original photos were published on Twitter by the Communist Party of India (Marxist) on June 16, 2020, and show the CPI(M) leaders protesting domestic policies of the ruling government led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
